ticket.tag: activerecord bug limit migrations patch validates_uniqueness_of validation
ticket.title: validates_uniqueness_of does not take field length into account
ticket.original-body:
With the following Event model:
@@@ ruby class CreateEvents < ActiveRecord::Migration def self.up create_table :events do |t| t.string :title, :limit => 5 t.text :description t.datetime :time t.timestamps end end
def self.down drop_table :events end end
class Event < ActiveRecord::Base
validates_uniqueness_of :title
end @@@
I can do something along the lines of:
>> e = Event.create(:title => "abcde") => #<Event id: 1, title: "abcde", description: nil, time: nil, created_at: "2008-09-14 09:01:14", updated_at: "2008-09-14 09:01:14"> >> e2 = Event.create(:title => "abcdefgh") => #<Event id: 2, title: "abcdefgh", description: nil, time: nil, created_at: "2008-09-14 09:01:31", updated_at: "2008-09-14 09:01:31"> >> Event.find_all_by_title("abcde") => [#<Event id: 1, title: "abcde", description: nil, time: nil, created_at: "2008-09-14 09:01:14", updated_at: "2008-09-14 09:01:14">, #<Event id: 2, title: "abcde", description: nil, time: nil, created_at: "2008-09-14 09:01:31", updated_at: "2008-09-14 09:01:31">]
The titles are unique until you apply the :limit => 5 but validates_uniqueness_of doesn't take this into account. This leaves two events with the title "abcde" in the database (MySQL, not SQLite, which doesn't enforce varchar limits).
ticket.latest-body:
With the following Event model:

def self.down drop_table :events end end
class Event < ActiveRecord::Base
validates_uniqueness_of :title
end @@@
I can do something along the lines of:
>> e = Event.create(:title => "abcde") => #<Event id: 1, title: "abcde", description: nil, time: nil, created_at: "2008-09-14 09:01:14", updated_at: "2008-09-14 09:01:14"> >> e2 = Event.create(:title => "abcdefgh") => #<Event id: 2, title: "abcdefgh", description: nil, time: nil, created_at: "2008-09-14 09:01:31", updated_at: "2008-09-14 09:01:31"> >> Event.find_all_by_title("abcde") => [#<Event id: 1, title: "abcde", description: nil, time: nil, created_at: "2008-09-14 09:01:14", updated_at: "2008-09-14 09:01:14">, #<Event id: 2, title: "abcde", description: nil, time: nil, created_at: "2008-09-14 09:01:31", updated_at: "2008-09-14 09:01:31">]
The titles are unique until you apply the :limit => 5 but validates_uniqueness_of doesn't take this into account. This leaves two events with the title "abcde" in the database (MySQL, not SQLite, which doesn't enforce varchar limits).
ticket.original-body-html:
With the following Event model:


class CreateEvents < ActiveRecord::Migration
  def self.up
    create_table :events do |t|
      t.string :title, :limit => 5
      t.text :description
      t.datetime :time
      t.timestamps
    end
  end

  def self.down
    drop_table :events
  end
end

class Event < ActiveRecord::Base

  validates_uniqueness_of :title

end

I can do something along the lines of:

e = Event.create(:title => "abcde") => # e2 = Event.create(:title => "abcdefgh") => # Event.find_all_by_title("abcde") => [#, #]

The titles are unique until you apply the :limit => 5 but validates_uniqueness_of doesn't take this into account. This leaves two events with the title "abcde" in the database (MySQL, not SQLite, which doesn't enforce varchar limits).

class Event < ActiveRecord::Base
validates_uniqueness_of :title

I can do something along the lines of:
>> e = Event.create(:title => "abcde") => #<Event id: 1, title: "abcde", description: nil, time: nil, created_at: "2008-09-14 09:01:14", updated_at: "2008-09-14 09:01:14"> >> e2 = Event.create(:title => "abcdefgh") => #<Event id: 2, title: "abcdefgh", description: nil, time: nil, created_at: "2008-09-14 09:01:31", updated_at: "2008-09-14 09:01:31"> >> Event.find_all_by_title("abcde") => [#<Event id: 1, title: "abcde", description: nil, time: nil, created_at: "2008-09-14 09:01:14", updated_at: "2008-09-14 09:01:14">, #<Event id: 2, title: "abcde", description: nil, time: nil, created_at: "2008-09-14 09:01:31", updated_at: "2008-09-14 09:01:31">]
The titles are unique until you apply the :limit => 5 but validates_uniqueness_of doesn't take this into account. This leaves two events with the title "abcde" in the database (MySQL, not SQLite, which doesn't enforce varchar limits).

With the following Event model:


class CreateEvents < ActiveRecord::Migration

      t.text :description

end

I can do something along the lines of:

>> Event.find_all_by_title("abcde")
=> [#<Event id: 1, title: "abcde", description: nil, time: nil, created_at: "2008-09-14 09:01:14", updated_at: "2008-09-14 09:01:14">, #<Event id: 2, title: "abcde", description: nil, time: nil, created_at: "2008-09-14 09:01:31", updated_at: "2008-09-14 09:01:31">]
version.title: validates_uniqueness_of does not take field length into account

version.body:
I realize that this could be taken care of if I set validates_length_of :title, :maximum => 5 in my model. However, I don't like having to repeat that (since I specified it in the migration) and I'm still worried about the database being in an inconsistent state.
A basic fix to this could be adding the following after line 669 in lib/active_record/validations.rb:
@@@ ruby value = value[0, finder_class.columns_hash[attr_name.to_s].limit] @@@
version.body-html:
I realize that this could be taken care of if I set validates_length_of :title, :maximum => 5 in my model. However, I don't like having to repeat that (since I specified it in the migration) and I'm still worried about the database being in an inconsistent state.

A basic fix to this could be adding the following after line 669 in lib/active_record/validations.rb:


value = value[0, finder_class.columns_hash[attr_name.to_s].limit]
version.title: validates_uniqueness_of does not take field length into account

version.body: I went ahead and submitted a patch.
version.body-html: I went ahead and submitted a patch.

version.body:
That's a good catch and it looks very tricky as well.
I can't see any patch. Could you please upload a patch here - http://rails.lighthouseapp.com/projects/8994/sending-patches ?
Thanks.
version.body-html:

I can't see any patch. Could you please upload a patch here - http://rails.lighthouseapp.com/p... ?

Thanks.
version.title: validates_uniqueness_of does not take field length into account

version.body: This patch makes ActiveRecord's validates_uniqueness_of take :limit into account for :string columns.
version.body-html: This patch makes ActiveRecord's validates_uniqueness_of take :limit into account for :string columns.

version.body:
(from [ccb0a92fa2ba0bf7be50033090c3a861e6d907be]) Ensure validates_uniqueness_of considers limit on the field. [#1042 state:resolved]
Signed-off-by: Pratik Naik <pratiknaik@gmail.com> http://github.com/rails/rails/commit/ccb0a92fa2ba0bf7be50033090c3a861e6d907be
